sdks.name: Qiskit
sdks.description: IBM's open-source quantum computing framework. Full-stack from circuits to hardware.

sdks.name: Cirq
sdks.description: Google's Python library for writing, manipulating, and optimizing quantum circuits.

sdks.name: PennyLane
sdks.description: Cross-platform Python library for quantum machine learning and differentiable programming.

platforms.name: IBM Quantum
platforms.description: Access to IBM's quantum processors and simulators via cloud.

platforms.name: AWS Braket
platforms.description: Amazon's managed quantum computing service with multiple hardware providers.

platforms.name: Azure Quantum
platforms.description: Microsoft's quantum computing platform with diverse hardware options.

classical.name: Python
classical.description: Primary language for quantum algorithm development and integration.

classical.name: Cloud-Native Tools
classical.description: Kubernetes, Docker, and CI/CD for scalable deployment.

whyHybrid: Today's quantum hardware is limited by qubit counts, noise, and connectivity. Hybrid quantum-classical approaches deliver value now by combining the strengths of both paradigms, while preparing your infrastructure for future quantum advances.
